meanings.definition: A particular time or instance of an event.
meanings.sent1: On special occasions, we celebrate with cake and balloons.
meanings.sent2: Birthdays and holidays are common occasions for family gatherings.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocking over the vase was an occasion for laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her graduation was an occasion for pride and joy.
meanings.sent5: The wedding was a beautiful occasion filled with love and happiness.

meanings.definition: A reason or cause for doing something.
meanings.sent1: The lack of funds was the occasion for canceling the trip.
meanings.sent2: His illness became the occasion for his friends to show their support.
meanings.sent3: Running out of milk was an occasion for a quick trip to the store.
meanings.sent4: The stormy weather was the occasion for staying indoors and reading a book.
meanings.sent5: The broken car was the occasion for learning how to fix it.

meanings.sent1: Her smile occasions happiness in everyone around her.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise occasioned a startle among the crowd.
meanings.sent3: His unexpected visit occasioned a pleasant surprise for his family.
meanings.sent4: The new policy occasioned a lot of discussion among the employees.
meanings.sent5: The success of the project occasioned a celebration in the office.
